Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Scarab
Description: Small scarab with basic details. The head and the clypeus are depicted. The prothorax is indicated by two lateral incisions, as are the legs. The reverse is decorated with a carved spiral that ends in a flower, together with a nefer sign ("beautiful, good, perfect").
